newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean securities firms' 9-month losses fall.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean securities firms' 9-month losses fall.

text.p: South Korean securities firms posted pre-tax losses of a combined 491.8 billion won in the April-December period, down from 623.6 billion won in losses a year earlier, the Securities Supervisory Board said on Sunday.
The board said in a report the drop in net losses was mainly due to sharp rises in commission income, helped by the bullish stock market between April and May last year.

Dae Yu posted a pre-tax net profit of 5.5 billion won in the nine-month period, compared with a pre-tax net loss of 800 million won a year earlier, and KFB Securities recorded a 3.8 billion won profit versus a 3.2 billion loss a year ago.
LG Securities saw its net loss widening to 48.2 billion won from a year earlier's 42.4 billion and the net loss of Dongsuh rose to 47.6 billion won from 45.4 billion won.
The companies' fiscal year ends in March.
